result.execSummary:
The defendant John D Tucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to 15CM1565,  with credit for 0 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Pay a fine of $200.00 plus all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

ABSOLUTE NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review on 4-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John D Tucker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John D Tucker in court.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS to count 2:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Count 1 is ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.    Additional statement by Karen S.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to 15CM1565,  with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months, concurrent.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive,  STAYED pending a review on 4-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-ABSOLUTE NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay a fine of $200.00 plus all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  Defense informs the Court that the defendant wants to change his plea.  Jury Trial date to convert to plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant does not qualify for public defender appointment.  Statements by the Defendant.  Based upon review of the Defendant's statements made in court, the Court finds that the Defendant does qualifiy for representation at the County's expense. Court will appoint counsel for Defendant.  The Court appoints Joseph Schubert  to represent Defendant who is present in court and accepts.  Court ordered Defendant to contribute to legal expenses at a rate of  $50.00 per month while this case is pending.  The first payment is due 11-1-2015  and on the 1st  of every month thereafter throughout the course of the case.  All payments should be made directly to the Clerk of Courts Office.  
  Case set for final pretrial on 12-16-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 1-6-2016 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 11-5-2015.  ls  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Counsel informed Court that defendant can no longer meet financial obligation.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel
